page.title: 03MONT ORGUEIL CASTLE (2)
page.content: In this account of our visit I am going to act as a guide to show you around this magnificent fortress. From here, outside the towering granite curtain walls, we can see uneven rocks on the west side of the castle, which are part of the mound, and indicate how strong it must be with rock as a foundation. As we cross the bridge over the dry grass moat you come to the first of four gates, where there used to be a portcullis. This entrance was very heavily guarded as it was the weakest point of the castle, facing the landward side. To strengthen it even more the{Harliston Tower,}which you can see on your left, was built in 1470. The second gate, built in the 13th century, also had a drawbridge and a portcullis.
